de.frauas.jdemandmodel.appliance

Class Appliance

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.frauas.jdemandmodel.appliance.Appliance
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ElectricSpaceHeating, StorageHeater

    public class Appliance
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the representation of an appliance. There are 3 different types of appliances:

    Group A) A standard appliance has an activity value between 0 and 5 and therefore a use profile (see Activity) - whether it's turned on is decided upon the active occupancy, the scale factor and the use profile.

    Group B) An appliance with an activity value of -1 has no use profile - whether it's turned on is decided upon the active occupancy and the scale factor.

    Group C) An appliance with an activity value of -2 has no use profile - whether it's turned on is decided solely upon the scale factor.

    Also worth mentioning are the classes ElectricSpaceHeating and StorageHeater which extend an Appliance and overwrite the "checkStartEvent" method.

    The classes WashingMachineCycle and WashingCycle are used for a WASHING_MACHINE and WASHER_DRYER and the only two appliances that use a power cycle different from the StandardPowerCycle. They count as group B appliances, but have the additional characteristic of not being turned off, when the occupancy turns 0 (see method "nextWattage").

    Author:
    lukas

        public Appliance(Device device,
                 ApplianceData data,
                 Matrix useProfile,
                 PowerCycle powerCycle)
        Constructs a new object Appliance.
        Parameters:
        device - the device associated with this appliance
        data - an ApplianceData instance holding the appliance's data
        useProfile - matrix that for every possible occupancy contains an array of activity probabilities for all time intervals
        powerCycle - the power cycle for this appliance

      • Appliance

        Constructs a new object Appliance. No use profile is needed.
        Parameters:
        device - the device associated with this appliance
        data - an ApplianceData instance holding the appliance's data
        powerCycle - the power cycle for this appliance

        public ApplianceData getApplianceData()

      • checkUseProfile

        private void checkUseProfile(Matrix useProfile)
        This method checks the validity of the passed useProfile array list. (size = 6, each array length = 144, each value 0 <= x <= 1)
        Parameters:
        useProfile - the use profile to be checked
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a probability value within the use profile is less than 0 or greater than 1

      • checkStartEvent

        protected boolean checkStartEvent(int activeOccupancy)
        This method uses the statistical data retrieved from the csv files to decide, whether an appliance should be turned on at the given time interval and with the specified current active occupancy. The probability for being turned on of appliances that don't have a use profile depends on the scale factor and only so far on the occupancy as they can't be turned on, if it equals 0 (no residents present or awake), except for freezers or the refrigerator (activity value -2).
        Parameters:
        activeOccupancy - the current active occupancy of the dwelling
        Returns:
        true, if the appliance should be turned on, otherwise false.

      • doStart

        private void doStart()
        Simulates the event of turning on the appliance. A new using cycle begins and the current power of the appliance is set to the first power usage value of the cycle.

      • doStop

        private void doStop()
        If an appliance is not used anymore this internal method is called, setting the power to the stand-by value and starting a delay for the appliance to be used again.

      • getPower

        public int getPower()
        Returns:
        Returns the current power of the appliance.

      • getLeftRestartDelay

        public int getLeftRestartDelay()
        Returns:
        Returns the current restart delay of the appliance.

      • getLeftCycleTime

        public int getLeftCycleTime()
        Returns:
        Returns the currently left cycle time of the appliance.

      • nextWattage

        public void nextWattage(int activeOccupancy)
        This method manages the stages of the appliance through time and handles three cases.

        First, if the left cycle time and the restart time of an appliance equal 0, that means that the appliance is turned off, but ready to be turned on and it is checked for a start event (using the statistical data retrieved from the csv files).

        Second, if the cycle time is greater 0, which means that the appliance is turned on, several things can happen: Appliances that depend on the active occupancy will be turned off, if no one is present or awake. For other occupancy values, in any case, the left cycle time will be reduced by one and the next power usage value will be calculated. However, if the left cycle time reaches 0 and the appliance's restart delay equals 0, it has to be checked right away whether the appliance should be started again. If not, the appliance is turned off.

        Finally, if the left cycle time is 0, but there's some restart delay left, the restart delay is decreased by one.

        Parameters:
        activeOccupancy - the current active occupancy of the dwelling

      • hasNextTimeInterval

        public static boolean hasNextTimeInterval()
        This method iterates through the time intervals and intended to be used in a while-loop.
        Returns:
        false, if the next time interval equals 1440 (the last minute of the day), otherwise true. When reaching the last time interval, the time of all appliances is reset to -1.
